channel.title: Airtest on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Airtest on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Airtest, one question one answer. Unity app E2E test starting with Airtest and Poco
item.description: This article is the 12/20 article of [Sumzap Advent Calendar 2019 #1](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/sumzap1). What is # Airtest https://airtest.netease.com/ Cross platform UI automation IDE developed and published by NetEase. Here we will refer to the generic name of IDEs and projects for automated testing of mobile applications that use image recognition. By using this, you can create test code without knowing the code on the project directly. You can mass-produce the test as if it were an E2E test, or repeat the same action endlessly as an aging test.

item.title: [Python] Creating an environment for test automation with AirtestIDE (Tips)
item.description: #Introduction Recently, I started the test automation of smartphone apps (games) with AirtestIDE. So I would like to spell out what I did to create the script and environment that I actually created. #environment macOS 10.13.6 Airtest IDE 1.2.2 (Python) Android 9 #script Import commonly used scripts from airtest.core.api import using using("common.air") from common import * When I was wondering what to do, it was said in the official document https://airtest.
